title: French Inspired Tempeh Platter
method: Prep: finely chop the onion and slice the courgette.
Bring a shallow pan of seasoned liquid to a bare simmer.
Poach tempeh 8–12 min until opaque and flaky.
Rest meat 3–5 min if applicable. Season to taste with lemon, herbs, and chili to preference.
Plate as suggested below and enjoy.
plating: Serve tempeh neatly over grains with veg to one side; finish with chopped basil, a wedge of lemon, and a drizzle of olive oil for a clean French presentation.
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal, more if training on the day.
swaps: Swap grains for cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Use tofu or chicken interchangeably to suit dietary preference.
Add chili to taste for more heat.

title: Chilean Style Salmon Fillet Curry
method: Prep: finely chop the onion and slice the spinach.
Preheat oven to 150°C.
Toss salmon fillet with oil, salt, pepper and spices; spread on a tray with veg.
Slow-roast for 16–22 minutes until salmon fillet is cooked through (75°C internal for poultry).
Rest meat 3–5 min if applicable. Season to taste with lemon, herbs, and chili to preference.
Plate as suggested below and enjoy.
plating: Serve salmon fillet neatly over grains with veg to one side; finish with chopped tarragon, a wedge of lemon, and a drizzle of olive oil for a clean Chilean presentation.
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal, more if training on the day.
swaps: Swap grains for cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Use tofu or chicken interchangeably to suit dietary preference.
Add chili to taste for more heat.
